byline.original: By PETER BAKER and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Iranian leaders have insisted in recent days that the sanctions be lifted as soon as a written accord is signed, a position that the country’s foreign minister reinforced on Friday.

headline.print_headline: President Favors Way to Give Iran Political Cover
headline.main: Obama Urges ‘Creative’ Talks to Bridge Divide With Iran on Sanctions

snippet: Iranian leaders have insisted in recent days that the sanctions be lifted as soon as a written accord is signed, a position that the country’s foreign minister reinforced on Friday.
abstract: Pres Obama tells diplomats to try to craft solution regarding Iranian nuclear talks that will appeal to opposing political constituencies in Iran, signal that Obama is willing to be flexible in order to keep tentative agreement from falling apart; says his priority is to preserve way to punish Iran if it fails to abide by deal and suggests that timing and structure of sanctions relief is open to negotiation.
